alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 21 at 2:43AM MDT until May 21 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: .Snow will continue to slowly decrease from north to south across the region this morning. Light snow will linger across the Front Range urban corridor with bands of moderate to heavy snow showers primarily over the Palmer Divide. Snow accumulation on trees this morning will cause some tree limbs to break and produce scattered power outages. Do not park under trees and avoid walking under snow laden trees. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. * WHERE...Byers, and Limon. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT today. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
